reviews.text:
The location of the hotel was perfect, the location of my room wasn’t.

It was on the second floor opposite a Karaoke Bar that opened until 3am!! There was no air conditioning and if I opened the window, it was like I was in the Bar and if I shut the window, you could still hear every word!

I was there for business and had been since 4am so really needed a good and early sleep!

I asked to move rooms and was told it was fully booked and to take some earplugs.

Bed was comfortable, breakfast was nice but please, ensure you face the courtyard if you need to sleep!!

Hotel Bondeheimen is very close to the city center. The location is within walking distance of key attractions, shopping areas, and public transportation, making it super convenient for getting around.

The rooms are cozy, clean, and well-equipped and looking out to nice street view.

Great hotel and a great location. You are within walking distance to nearly everything in the city Center. The service is very great. My friend broke her wrist and staff was so supportive and helpful through our whole stay. Thanks to that.

Rooms are having a good size. Window to open a bit. You find all you need. Thanks to the house keeping for all the comfort you gave us.

Hotell Bondeheimen in Oslo is a superb choice for accommodation, offering a convenient location within walking distance of key attractions. The hotel features an incredible breakfast buffet, comfortable beds, and clean, cozy rooms. The staff is friendly and accommodating, ensuring a pleasant stay for all guests. Highly recommended for travelers looking for a comfortable and enjoyable experience in Oslo.

I never leave bad review but my experience with the staff at this hotel was beyond horrible and frustrating. After stating months in advance some necessary accommodations due to medical reasons, that weren’t met, my family was willing to pay for the difference in price, but the staff refused to work with us, even though we could see other rooms available on the booking site, making difficult to even meet in the middle. It left my family no other choice, but to try to find a different hotel that was willing to work with us.
